text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with sweet salty spicy nuts that's
right when you go to as many parties as
i do you eat a lot of mixed nuts and
they generally range from plain to man i
wish these were plain
sure you could go to the fancy gourmet
shop and buy a little sack of nuts for
like ten dollars but why pay all that
money when you can make a better
perfectly glazed batch at home
seasoned exactly like you want so we're
going to start by tossing our nuts in a
large metal bowl i'm using four kinds
these are not salted I have some walnut
halves some pecan halves some whole
cashews and some whole almonds so once
your nuts are in the bowl you're gonna
go ahead and spice them up any way you
want
I'm gonna go fairly standard nothing too
crazy I'm gonna go with some cayenne
pepper I know that's a big shot so lots
of cayenne I like mine a little spicy
I'm also going to put in a pinch of
cumin which I find interesting in this a
good amount of salt and some freshly
ground black pepper
and that's pretty much it for me if you
want to have a little bit of smokiness
you could use smoked paprika Chipotle
lots of different ways you can go here
okay once your nuts are seasoned to your
liking we're going to go over to the
stove where we're going to make a very
simple butter CERP which is just butter
sugar and water just put it in a small
saucepan put it over medium heat give it
a stir and what's going to happen the
butter is going to melt the sugar is
going to dissolve and it's going to
start to boil and as soon as it starts
to bubble I'm just gonna let it cook for
one minute and then turn it off that's
it alright once that's done you're going
to slowly and carefully pour that over
your nuts and then take a big old
spatula and give it a nice mixing
alright it's going to be very thin at
first because it's still very hot but as
it starts to coat those nuts it's going
to thicken up a little bit you're going
to see your nuts become very glossy just
gorgeous and once that's all mixed
together we're pretty much ready for the
oven
so what we're going to do is we're going
to prep a sheet pan by covering it in
foil I'm going to spray it with some
vegetable oil we're going to use our
spatula to transfer the nuts onto the
pan all right
I want to spread them out and to
basically a single layer but they
definitely should be nestled up against
each other it's not a problem if your
nuts are touching each other that looks
perfect and those are going to go in a
preheated 350 degree oven for exactly
ten minutes and ten minutes later
they're going to be partially roasted
not totally done but getting close so
what we're going to do this point we're
going to take our spatula and we're
going to give them a toss right on the
pan and what's going to happen that
really hot quite thin sugar syrup that
currently is like 350 degrees is going
to cool down a little bit it's going to
thicken up a little bit and you're going
to see as you keep stirring this your
nuts are going to get a little sticky
that SERPs going to thicken up a little
bit and it's going to coat them
beautifully and as you stir you're going
to see less and less on the bottom of
the pan because it's going to be
attached to your nuts so I probably
stirred that for about four or five
minutes at that point I'm going to
spread them back out put it back in the
oven for exactly six minutes and at that
point your sweet salty spicy nuts should
be done they should be perfectly roasted
and as they cool they're going to get
the look of those fancy gourmet shop
nuts they should have a beautiful glaze
not only are they as beautiful as the
ones from the gourmet shop you get to
make them and spice them any way you
want so this really is a great method
and as you saw extremely simple and of
course yes this would make a great
homemade edible holiday gift all right
